title: Lawyer, Personal Injury & AI Innovation Specialist
job_overview:
The Opportunity
MEDirect is a fast-growing Australian medico-legal technology company. Our AI-enabled Medicolegal Report Assistant is entering its next development phase, and we need an experienced personal injury lawyer to embed legal rigour, design guardrails and help train the system. You will translate complex legal nuances into usable AI workflows while ensuring that our human-in-the-loop model, where the medical expert’s opinion always prevails and remains intact. If you’re passionate about technology’s role in modern legal practice, this is your chance to shape the future of medicolegal reporting.

This is a full-time, work-from-home role, working Monday-Friday 9 am – 6 pm, Australian EST, and includes benefits such as leaves and a 13-month payment, plus HMO after successfully passing 6 months ' probation. You’ll become part of our team. In doing so, you must be able to demonstrate your capacity to have a secure working-from-home environment without distractions, including suitable childcare arrangements, backup power & internet connections, and a co-working space nearby if required. 

Key Responsibilities
1. Elevate Report Quality with AI Integration

Review completed medicolegal reports to confirm every template field is populated and each Letter of Instruction question is fully answered.

Use AI-powered tools to proofread language, structure, grammar, formatting, and visual consistency, ensuring compliance with best practice guidelines.

Draft concise clarification queries for medical experts, resolving any gaps or ambiguities.

Provide detailed legal feedback to product and data science teams, directly influencing model accuracy, relevance and ethical compliance.

Capture medical expert feedback and translate it into product improvements that enhance—never replace—clinical reasoning.

2. Collaborate & Innovate

Act as the subject matter expert for product, engineering and AI teams during design sprints, feature testing and release reviews.

Work closely with medical specialists to clarify instructions, resolve issues and drive continuous quality improvements.

Engage insurers, regulators, and other stakeholders to ensure that the AI assistant meets statutory and industry standards.

Experience & Qualifications
________________________________________
Experience & Qualifications
•	Licensed lawyer in the Philippines.
•	Minimum of five (5) years' experience in personal injury law, with direct exposure to the Australian or US legal systems.
•	Strong familiarity with medicolegal reporting, insurance assessments, and litigation documentation.
•	Competency in the AMA4 and AMA5 guides.
•	Demonstrated experience reviewing and editing expert reports, legal submissions, or court documents.
•	Exceptional written and verbal English, with native-level grammar, legal reasoning, and editorial skills.
•	Meticulous attention to detail with the confidence to challenge omissions or inconsistencies.
•	Advanced skills in Microsoft Word (including styles, templates, track changes, and document comparison).
•	Strong skills in the full Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel & Outlook, and other relevant corporate software such as Slack.
•	Technologically confident, with proven experience using legal tech platforms, AI-enabled tools, or structured document review systems, and a keen interest in prompt training AI applications.
•	Proven ability to work remotely, independently, and to tight deadlines.

How to Apply
Submit your resume, a cover letter detailing your relevant experience based on the criteria, and a redacted sample of a medicolegal (or similar) document you have created, reviewed or edited. Applications without a cover letter and a sample document will not be reviewed. Please include at least two references and their current contact information.
Applications close on 18th July, or earlier, pending applicant volume.
